Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Horsham Road.

Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by an unplanned power cut in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. This work is taking place near Glassmoor Bank.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Following a third-party request, we will be upgrading a transformer on our electricity network to allow for a new connection to be made. We will also be upgrading the overhead electricity cables. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area, ensuring that the network can cope with the increased electricity demand and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers may have experienced an unplanned power cut in the last 6 months. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we install the new transformer. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place near The Holloway and Tring Hill.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 16:27 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Semley Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 14:37 - Thanks for bearing with us today; I know having a power cut can be difficult, but we've had some good news from our staff.

Our engineers have made good headway with their repairs, and based on how things are progressing they now hope to have power back on by 17:00 and 18:00; a little ahead of their estimate.

We want to get your power back on as quickly as we can, but I know any change to our estimated time frame may have disrupted your plans. Our staff always have safety in mind, so sometimes our time frames have to change at short notice, so I'll keep you updated and if our staff offer any adjustment to this new time frame, I'll let you know.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Will, Decasta and David are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 14:37. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We had to turn off power in your area so our engineers could safely carry out emergency repairs to the network.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Aaron at 22:08 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all customers in the Bungay NR35 2 area, by repairing and re-erecting the low overhead cable. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 18:15 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 18:20 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1634 customers in the Waltham Abbey EN9 and surrounding  area, by diverting power around an overhead network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Waltham Abbey EN9 and surrounding  area to investigate the power cut affecting 7 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Kevin at 17:58.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Kevin at 17:50 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is on our overhead network that initially interrupted power to 1634 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 7 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 20:00 and 21:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 17:41. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Talie, Theo, Simon and David are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 05:48 - I'm very sorry you're still without power.

Our engineers have been working hard to get you back on, but our engineers need to access the remaining properties, so we now need to send out a relief team first thing in the morning. This means that you may not receive any texts for a while.

We'll let you know as soon as our staff re-attend and we have some more information, but if you have any concerns in the meantime you can always reach our team here on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent at 05:46 by Aaron - More electricity has been diverted thanks to our ground team's continued work, and the lights are now safely back on to more properties.

We know that some properties are still without electricity. If this is the case at your property, don't worry; I'll still keep you informed.

If your electricity has come back on now, or does so at any time in the future, simply click this link to stop receiving our SMS updates: bit.ly/348KOZ3.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 19:15 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hovefields Avenue area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Hovefields Avenue area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Kevin at 19:04.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 18:55 - Our staff are on the way to the Hovefields Avenue area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 22:00 and 23:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 19:19 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Gloucester Road area, the estimated time of 00:00 and 01:00 hasn't changed.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can.

We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Kevin at 21:05.

MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 23:36 - Our engineers have restored power to all 187 properties in the High Road SG11 1 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around the overhead network fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Our staff have now arrived on site in the Islington High Street area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Aaron at 01:26.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 00:55 - Our staff are on the way to the Islington High Street area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 04:00 and 05:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 03:46 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1735 customers in the NR11 8/NR27 9 area, by diverting power around the overhead network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 03:13 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 1735 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 353 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 05:30-06:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 06:08 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: An underground electricity cable has faulted on our high voltage network, causing an area wide power cut.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Simon at 06:35 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 17 properties still affected by the overhead network fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 87 of our customers.

We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Sent by Simon at 06:08 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Simon, Theo and Talie are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Uckfield TN22 area and are investigating the fault.

You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 122 customers. There are now 104 properties still affected.

We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Aaron at 05:54.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV UG Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 27-JAN-2026 07:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Talie at 06:27.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Hornsey Rise area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Talie at 06:04.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Talie, Theo, Simon and David are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 05:18 - Our staff are on the way to the Hornsey Rise area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 08:30 and 09:30. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Saffron Walden CB10 2 area to investigate the power cut affecting 211 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Theo at 06:24.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 05:28 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead network fault affecting 211 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 07:30 and 08:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.

We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV UG Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 26-JAN-2026 12:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 06:50. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which has caused a power cut in the local area.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.
